cyclone.name: FLORENCE
cyclone.current_location: about 205 miles ESE of Wilmington, North Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: Moving northwest then slowing and bending west-northwest toward the southern North Carolina coast, followed by a very slow west-southwest drift inland across the Carolinas through the weekend.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near or just north of Wilmington, NC
cyclone.hours_to_offshore: Not expected to track offshore near New York within the 5-day period

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch in effect Edisto Beach SC to South Santee River SC
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning South Santee River SC to Duck NC; Tropical-Storm Warning north of Duck NC to Cape Charles Light VA and lower Chesapeake Bay
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Primary impacts focused along the North and South Carolina coasts with inland progression toward GA, TN, VA and OH Valley
weather_observation.wind: Gusty easterly winds possible late Sunday into Monday, generally below 35 mph.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected for the New York / New Jersey Harbor.
weather_observation.rainfall: Periods of rain Monday–Tuesday, most totals 1–2 inches with isolated 3 inch pockets.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous rip currents and high surf along the New Jersey and Long Island beaches through the weekend.
